eventName: Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures
storyInfo: The robbery proceeds smoothly, and in the wake of a huge explosion, a mountain of bank notes appears before everyone's eyes.

attributes.content: All squads are fully prepared and ready to return to the landship at a moment's notice.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Where's Jessica? Still can't reach her?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Her communicator... is broken again.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Twice in one operation? That's too much of a coincidence. What is that girl up to?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Jessica, you're finally back!
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: ...Sorry.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Don't worry about it. Laura's already packed your bags.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: It's not that... I...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I'm... here to say goodbye.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Goodbye?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Are you applying for temporary leave?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: ...I guess?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: And your reason for doing so?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Personal reasons. There's some personal stuff I have to do, no matter what.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: And how long will you be gone?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: I don't know. Maybe a week, maybe a year...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Did you hit your head? Do you really expect us to grant temporary leave for up to a year?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: If that isn't an option, then... can I hand in my resignation?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You're quitting?!
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Ah, right. You said from the start that you're here to say goodbye. And goodbyes don't need an application.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I don't know what brought this on all of a sudden, but I need to remind you: If you leave the team, everything you've worked so hard for in Blacksteel will likely go up in smoke.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Whatever it is you need to do, are you willing to trade all of your efforts until now for it?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: These are the last explosives left in the mine. Let's go grab 'em.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I'll do the inspection. You go ahead and rest for now.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Um, Leone...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Are you sure about this...? About blowing up the furnace?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I know I shouldn't be saying this, but you were so reluctant when we talked about blowing up the energy tower...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If we don't blow it up, how else are we gonna seal the secret passage and hide Helena's whereabouts?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: As for what I personally think... It ain't important. Don't matter no more.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Ain't a single thing left in Davistown that can be fixed up.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: But if we get that money, there's still hope for us, someday down the road. Out on the frontier. Right?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ...There will be. For sure.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Heh. Hope. Hope... Who knew one last glimmer of hope would be so damn expensive?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: But for this last bit of hope, for this ticket not to reach the end of the line today... I have to accept that, even if it costs me my life.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I have no idea what you're trying to accomplish, Jessica, but can you guarantee you won't regret it?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: When using the welding gun, pay attention to the angle between it and the weld. Holding it too high causes spattering, and makes it easy to get hurt.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: For a woman who runs a diner, you sure know way too many things.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Heh. I spent more than two decades traveling across grand ol' Columbia. I had a lot of choices.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...When you got dumped, did you ever think about going home?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Dumped?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Oh, I get it. Leone must've gotten the wrong idea.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Nah, I'm the one who dumped him. He ended up being a real by-the-books sorta fella... Didn't suit that gruff face of his one bit.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Back then, I was dead set on travelling across Columbia with him, but he thought I was too wild... Still, we supported each other across the barrens, and I ain't saying it was a bad life.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: But one night, he suddenly proposed to me. Said he couldn't stand all that wandering no more, and he wanted to settle down on some plate.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Going through the same motions in the same place, over and over again? I couldn't imagine a worse punishment.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: So I turned him down, left him all my money and possessions, and told him I'd make a terrible wife. Then I mounted my burdenbeast and rode off into the sunset.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: But... you still ended up in Davistown.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: In his letter, he said he'd finally fulfilled his old dream, and wanted me to drop by to visit.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: So I came here, thinking the whole trip about how to turn him down in a way that'd let him keep his middle-aged dignity.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: But... you know the rest. I was too late. He'd already passed away.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: And then you inherited his diner and stayed...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I didn't inherit it, I recaptured it. It'd been ransacked by a gang of thugs. Must've fought off at least fifteen of 'em.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: That's how life is. Romantic stories ain't always have romantic reasons. More often than not, the journey is just the punchline.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: All these years... Have you ever had any regrets?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Regrets?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Like, for eloping, for breaking up, for not being able to see him one last time. Or for staying behind in Davistown... Stuff like that.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Nope.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I feel bad about a lot of things, but I wouldn't say I regret 'em.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I've enjoyed the results of my choices, and accepted the costs. All with complete peace of mind.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...I don't know.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You made such a huge decision without even thinking it through?!
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: That's not what I mean. I've given a lot of thought to your questions, and I've heard other people's answers too. In a sense, I even agree with them.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But I can't just regurgitate what they said and let them make my choices for me... Because in the end, their answers aren't mine.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I don't know if throwing away my past life is too steep a cost. I don't know if I'll regret this later, nor do I know what'll happen to me in the future.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But despite all that, I have to do this.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Nevertheless, I have to reject Jessica Brynley's request to be temporarily discharged from the team.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: I see... Then I'll have to resign.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica...
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Liskarm... Captain?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Even the slickest, most experienced veterans who don't give two shits about their job wouldn't throw around the word 'resign' as casually as you do.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: But I also have to imagine that maybe what I'm seeing here is... a Jessica who's finally cast aside her fears and self-doubt. A Jessica who's truly found herself.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: I still object to your decision, vehemently, but if you've made up your mind...
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: I'm sorry. I really am...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Give it a break already.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: ...And stay safe out there.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Jessica...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Laura.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: To tell you the truth, I had an inkling this would happen when I couldn't contact you. But if you've already made up your mind, can I get one last hug? Think of it as a parting gift.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Before Jessica can answer, Laura has already taken a few steps forward and wrapped her arms tightly around her.
With her back to Liskarm and Franka, she also stuffs a tiny slip of paper into Jessica's pocket.
(*whispers*) Wait until we're gone to read it.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Take care... Stay safe.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Anything else we need to do, Captain?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Then... let's get going.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Woodrow, are you and Leone really going to be safe out there in the woods? After the heist, there will definitely be a bunch of people after you.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You really need to start thinking about your own future, instead of fretting over us geezers.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...I haven't given it much thought. Maybe I'll have plenty of time to figure it out from a jail cell.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Not planning on staying a mercenary?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I just don't want to spend the rest of my life on a battlefield.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica... Whether you decide to keep fighting or to put the battlefield behind you, I just hope you won't blame yourself for not finding an answer.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: What did you end up choosing?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: After the Revolutionary War, I stumbled around blindly for a long, long time. Until I finally decided to live a boring life, day by day.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Does that really count as an answer?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Why not?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Just 'cause you're the only one who thinks so, doesn't mean it's wrong.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: You're still young. Got a long road ahead of you.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Will I... find my answer?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: As she looks at the now-abandoned safe house, Jessica feels a soreness coming from her nose.
She sniffles and gives it a rub, then opens up the slip of paper from before.
Following the instructions of a few numbers scribbled on the note, Jessica turns to an inconspicuous corner of the safe house where she finds a partition made from wooden boards.
Five, six, seven...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: The back of the eighth board is hollow...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: The cavity behind the board is filled to the brim with equipment, all brought here by Jessica herself when she set out from Blacksteel's landship.
Sitting on top is another note in the same style of scribbles.
'I take it you have unfinished business in Davistown. This gear should come in handy.'
'Just forget about everything else and do it. I believe in the choice you made, so believe in yourself, too.'
At the bottom of the note is one last line.
'Goodbye, Jessica. Hopefully, we already parted ways on a high note.'
Sorry, I'm not late, am I? I needed some time to sort through my gear.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's fine. We still got five minutes.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Where'd you get all this stuff?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: A parting gift from a friend.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Then I'll have to give 'em a right-and-proper thank you if we ever meet again.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: One last run-down. After we go through the door, Helena and Leone are in charge of clearing any obstacles and grabbing the money. Jessica and I will be on crowd-control, then we catch up afterwards.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Once the deed is done, Helena takes the money with her through the secret passage, while the rest of us draw attention away from her. Any questions?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: If only there were more explosives... We oughta give that bank a little surprise.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Settle down. If the info we got from Sylvia is correct, we'll need to save most of them to breach the last door.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: The key to our success is speed. We don't have much time. The mercs on duty will be back in half an hour.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Even if we can get the job done in that time, the explosion will definitely attract Blacksteel's attention. However, most of the mercenaries are back on the landship tonight, and it'll take them time to arrive.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If it comes to that, just leave it to me. I'll buy you the time you need.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Time to go.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Who the hell are you—!
attributes.name: Terrified Bank Employee

attributes.content: Hands off the alarm.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Aaaaaagh—
attributes.name: Terrified Bank Employee

attributes.content: This is a robbery.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: As long as y'all cooperate, nobody's getting hurt or dying tonight.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: No way... How is this happening—
attributes.name: Jittery Bank Employee

attributes.content: Shh... See, you're in the same boat as the other young lady over there. This is your one warning. We won't be so kind next time.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Now then, folks. Just don't panic, and follow our instructions.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Those are the conditions for your survival.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Seeing how there are no objections, why don't y'all mosey on over to the main lobby and squat down with your hands on your heads.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: We all know each other here. No funny business.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Now move it!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: You'll need to pass through a total of four doors to get to the vault. The first is the door to the reception area, which needs a key, but any employee can get it.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: The second is a passcode lock in the reception room. The code changes every day, but there are certain rules.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: From what I've gathered, today's code should be...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Perfect. The reception room key works.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Next up is the secret door... Behind the tapestry to the right of the entrance... Over here. Looks like Sylvia was right on the money.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Seven, nine, four, four, six, one... It worked? Well I'll be damned. That girl's got one good head on her shoulders.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: What's next...
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Inside the vault, there are two more doors. One's a security fence, the other is a vault door weighing dozens of tons.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: The security fence can be broken through by force, but because it's connected to the security system, the only safe way through is via passcode.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: The code is split into three parts, one for president, one for the manager, and another randomly generated by a cipher.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: The cipher is located in a safe inside the reception room, and you'll have to force that one open.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: How'd it go? Didn't damage anything inside the safe, did you?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Mint condition.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Can't believe your skills haven't rusted after not using 'em in years.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: What's the matter? That was an invitation for you to start bragging. I mean, ain't nobody else in this town with your skillset.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Don't mind me. Just worried how Woodrow's doing...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ...And that's number twenty-two. Now you're all tied up.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Next up is—
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I never imagined these would be the circumstances we'd meet again in, Miss Brynley...
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: I'd recommend worrying about your responsibilities first.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Also, I've heard this bank keeps a series of secret numbers, two of which are held by you and this gentlemen here. I hope you're both willing to cooperate.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Now take a walk with us. If you're not feeling cooperative, well, guess I'll have to shoot you.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Pick up the pace!
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Good evening, you two.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: H-Helena?! Wh-What's the meaning of this?
attributes.name: Bank President

attributes.content: You got nothing to fear, sir. I just wanted to ask you a few simple questions.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Will you tell us the passcode, or do we tie you to this door and blast you both to pieces? Your choice.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Friendly reminder: it is not a crime to reveal secrets under life-threatening duress.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: You damn thugs—
attributes.name: Bank President

attributes.content: Five.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Don't even think about it. You bastards don't deserve a single penny! You all deserve to rot out in the frontier!
attributes.name: Bank President

attributes.content: Four.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: You complacent idiots put all your eggs into the mine, yet still have the gall to whine to the bank after getting wiped out!
attributes.name: Bank President

attributes.content: Three.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Nobody gives a damn about your rotten minerals. It's the era of high tech and automation now! Your only value to Columbia is to be thrown out to the frontier, the sooner the better!
attributes.name: Bank President

attributes.content: Two.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: You filthy, uneducated hicks! You idiots don't even have a damn clue what numbers mean! Serves you right for getting tricked!
attributes.name: Bank President

attributes.content: One.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Sixfivefourseveneightfour!
attributes.name: Bank President

attributes.content: Hah... Never seen anyone spit out a string of numbers that fast.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Okay, now that your boss has squealed, it's your turn, ma'am.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Give me the passcode, or die.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Hurry up and tell them already! Do you really want to die here?!
attributes.name: Bank President

attributes.content: ...Mr. Theremin, what would you even do with the money? Do you seriously think you can get rid of us and start over out on the frontier?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Of course you can't. We're everywhere. We will follow your footsteps, and find you no matter where you go.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: The money you steal will smell as sweet as honey. And soon enough, our local associates will swarm all over you to eat it up.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: And with the promise of a few extra benefits, they'll even personally deliver your heads to us on a silver platter—
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: What's the goddamn passcode?!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough*...
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Three... six... eight... six... five... four.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Go on, take it. You won't accomplish a thing, my friends.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Nothing will change. This tragedy is doomed to happen again and again—
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Shut up.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Shut up? It is human nature to be greedy, and Mr. Theremin here is a prime example. Had he not been so eager to cling onto things that never belonged to him—
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: You shut your mouth!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: How far you've fallen to mingle with this sorry lot, Miss Jessica Brynley.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Leone Theremin here could have left this place ages ago. Taken his children with him to Ironforge City, Nulaiteburgh, or Bunkerhill...
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: What kind of blasting engineer wouldn't be able earn enough to put food on the table? How else would he have ended up like, if not for his greed?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Leone, she's right! The door's open!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Leone suddenly turns to look at Helena without saying a word. She is shocked to see the panic in his eyes.
It takes her a few moments to understand why.
Sorry, I meant... she gave us the right passcode.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I know... It's fine. I know.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: If you manage to open the first three doors, congratulations. The last is merely an extra credit question. It appears the most complicated, but the solution is the simplest...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Blast it open.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Leone, how are the explosives?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Primed and ready.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Do it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Like a precise surgical operation, the steel bars buried deep within the concrete are located with pinpoint accuracy and twisted until they break under the force of the explosion.
The fuel ignites under tremendous temperatures, bursting into layers upon layers of flames that gently wrap around the steel.
Then, at the moment it lets its guard down, all its defenses are stripped away.

The powerful backdraft caused by the explosion tears apart the stack of bank notes floating on the upper level, and the shredded paper is sent spiraling down the underground cavity. For a few moments, the snowfall here is heavier than it is outside.
The four people present are rendered speechless by this 'snow' that so many people could only dream of seeing.
Breathtaking...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Lord almighty, I've never seen this much money in my life.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: But it's also nothing compared to what the bank has bled from us.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: No time for idle thoughts, folks. Start filling those bags. We got more than enough to keep us busy.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Don't just stand there gawking... What are you thinking about?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Nothing in particular. It's just...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: This is the first time in my life I've ever wanted money so badly. It feels new... and exciting.
attributes.name: Jessica
